column4: How come i can connect to the internet thru xp/suse and not thru ubuntu and i configured ubuntu exactly like suse & xp, and it tells me about fixing my proxy?

guys help me out here.
its in*
How come i can connect to the internet thru xp/suse and not thru ubuntu and i configured ubuntu exactly like suse & xp, and it tells me about fixing my proxy?
open a terminal, try and ping www.yahoo.com
nah i can't ping the oustide world

yes i can also ping my ip
put ifconfig's output on paste.ubuntu-nl.org
i did let me give u the link
ok
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8624
eth1 is pulling a 192.168 ip which ain't gonna go anywhere... is it connected to a DHCP server?
no
do you have to specify your own IP?
yes
my connection is Lan
i put my ip and gateway and dns and  i configure proxy and i get internet
you haven't assigned a valid ip to eth1.
192.168.20.70 is *not* a valid external IP to connect to the internet.
